clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Study in Patients With Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Establish an Exercise Intervention in Patients With Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: In the course of their disease patients with Non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) often experience impaired psychological and physical functioning resulting in a reduced quality of life (QoL). The aim of the study is to explore the feasibility and the effects of an eight weeks combined muscle strength and endurance training on physical capacity and QoL.

detailed_description.textblock: In this open, prospective, single center study 40 patients (pts) with NSCLC undergoing adjuvant or palliative chemo-/ or radiotherapy are enrolled. Physical status is assessed by using the 6 Minute Walk Test (6MWT) for endurance and by using the Handheld Dynamometer (HHDM) for strength (flexion and extension of elbow, hip and knee). Psychological performance is measured by standardized questionnaires (MFI, FACT-L, PHQ - 9). Data are collected at baseline (T0) and after the 8 weeks sports intervention (T1). Pts are instructed to train at least 5 times/ week in the inpatient setting. After discharge pts are instructed to train in a home-based setting at least 3 times/week for a period of 8 weeks. Feasibility is defined as an adherence of two trainings per week during at least 6 weeks (out of 8 weeks of the intervention).

primary_outcome.measure: - number of patients who are adherent to the exercise intervention
primary_outcome.description: Adherence is defined as: completion of at least two training sessions per week during minimum six weeks out of eight weeks of the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: - effects of the exercise intervention on psychological symptoms (e.g. quality of life)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be measured by the standardized and validated questionnaire FACT-L;

secondary_outcome.measure: - effects of the exercise intervention on physical symptoms (muscle strength and endurance)
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle strength will be measured by hand held dynamometry and endurance by 6 Minute Walk Test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients
- histological confirmed diagnosis of Non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
- current treatment: chemo-and/or radiotherapy
- age > 18y
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 18
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute infection
- immobility > 2 days
- severe neurological impairment
- severe cardiac impairment
- severe pulmonal impairment
- severe renal impairment
- acute bleedings
- alcohol-/drug-abuse
